intro: Hibbertia brownii, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 meter, featuring yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is part of the Dilleniaceae family. Hibbertia brownii is well adapted to dry environments and is often found in sandy soils. It plays an important role in the ecological landscape of its native habitat.
